content:
At Qualtrics, we create software the world’s best brands use to deliver exceptional frontline experiences, build high-performing teams, and design products people love. But we are more than a platform—we are the creators and stewards of the Experience Management category serving over 18K clients globally. Building a category takes grit, determination, and a disdain for convention—but most of all it requires close-knit, high-functioning teams with an unwavering dedication to serving our customers.When you join one of our teams, you’ll be part of a nimble group that’s empowered to set aggressive goals and move fast to achieve them. Strategic risks are encouraged and complex problems are solved together, by passing the microphone and iterating until the best solution comes to light. You won’t have to look to find growth opportunities—ready or not, they’ll find you. From retail to government to healthcare, we’re on a mission to bring humanity, connection, and empathy back to business. Join over 6,000 people across the globe who think that’s work worth doing.

 
Why We Have This Role
We’re looking for a Content Designer to help develop and strengthen our products and experiences. Content designers at Qualtrics work just like a UX Designer and use things like language, communication, and storytelling throughout the product development and design process to create clear, inviting, and meaningful experiences for everyone.
How You’ll Find Success
You’ll leverage your expertise in design thinking and product strategy from the earliest strategic product discussions and design explorations, and deliver things like content frameworks, workshop outcomes, design principles, product flows, taxonomies, navigation, in-product messaging, product and feature naming, and more for both mobile and desktop experiences. You’ll also help scale the content design practice at Qualtrics by developing and contributing to things like content standards, tone and voice, terminology, and content quality.
Things You’ll Do


Help develop and define the overall product story or narrative to keep design decisions and user flows heading in the right direction.
Develop design and content principles and frameworks that scale with specific feature areas.
Apply systems thinking to the product either through IA work or system level design guidance.
Work alongside partners to design product flows and iterate based on feedback and research.
Design, write, edit, test, and improve things like onboarding flows, UI content, product and feature names, navigation labels, and terminology.
Give and solicit feedback from UX and product partners.
Edit and contribute to design and content in Figma or other design tools.
Collaborate with partners including engineering, UX design, research, data science, and product marketing from the earliest stages all the way through launch.
Partner with our localization team to ensure high quality experiences for every language and locale.
Help influence product decisions, team direction, and strategy.
Independently and proactively identify and work on projects that span multiple teams and product areas.
Develop and scale the content design discipline at Qualtrics by doing things like interviewing candidates, mentoring other content designers, developing content standards, building templates or guidance for our toolkit, and generally playing an active role in developing the skill and craft of the content design team.


What We’re Looking For On YourResume


5+ years experience as a content designer, content strategist, information architect, UX writer or similar role with a UX or product design team.
An online portfolio of relevant work samples. B2B SaaS work samples are a plus.
Ability to simplify and communicate complex concepts to a diverse audience.
Proven systems thinking, with ability to quickly learn about technical systems.
Design thinking and UX experience.
Experience working directly with product designers, product marketers, product managers, marketing copywriters, and researchers, driving projects that have major customer impact.
Demonstrated experience leading projects with minimal direction and managing ambiguity.


What You Should Know About This Team
This role will be part of a global UX team and report to the content design lead in Seattle, Washington. You’ll have a dedicated product area to focus on and will be deeply integrated into a design team as an equal partner in the development of the product.
Our Team’s Favorite Perks and Benefits


Unlimited Sick Days
QMentorship Program matches you with a mentor inside Qualtrics to get meaningful coaching from someone outside your team.
Amazing QGroup Communities; MOSAIQ, Green Team, Qualtrics Pride, Q&Able, Qualtrics Salute, and Women’s Leadership Development, which exist as places for support, allyship, and advocacy.

As part of this commitment, Qualtrics will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please let your Qualtrics contact/recruiter know.
 
Qualtrics Work Experience - As we look to the future, we believe that our teams are better together. Being together will help us learn more, grow faster and ultimately deliver better results for our customers and Qualtrics. Roles tied to an office location work 4 days per week in the office together and 1 day from home, with a strong spirit of flexibility around taking time for personal, health, and family moments in our work weeks. Our managers work with their teams to create a collaborative, engaged work environment, and arrangement that works for each of our team members.
 
Not finding a role that’s the right fit for now? Qualtrics Insiders is the one-stop shop for all things Qualtrics Life. Sign up for exclusive access to content created with you in mind and get the scoop on what we have going on at Qualtrics - upcoming events, behind the behind the scenes stories from the team, interview tips, hot jobs, and more. No spam - we promise! You'll hear from us two times a month max with fresh, totally tailored info - so be sure to stay connected as you explore your best role and company fit.

demographic_questions.description:
Why are you being asked to fill out two sets of demographic questions? Qualtrics is required by the federal government to distribute the Equal Employment Opportunity questions exactly as they are written. However, we recognize that the questions do not fully capture the fullness of a person’s identity and experience when it comes to gender identity, sexual orientation and race. DEI (Diversity, Equity and Inclusion) is a cornerstone of our company culture. We are committed to inclusivity in our hiring process and want to give you the opportunity to self-describe your identity.


With this in mind, we invite you to participate in this additional set of voluntary demographic questions. The data collected will be used anonymously and in aggregate, so we can evaluate our processes to ensure we’re providing equal opportunities to applicants from all backgrounds. Your responses, or your choice not to respond, will not be associated with your specific application and will not in any way be used for individual hiring or compensation decisions.
